data.title: I can't build my cocos2d-x or cocos2d-x's project by Ubuntu 17.04.
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: Ubuntu 17.04 x64
- developing environments
   - NDK version: I do not know.
   - Xcode version: I do not know what it is.
   - VS version: I do not know what it is.
   - browser type and version: firefox, but I do not know the version, and I do not use browser.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. download cocos2d-x-3.15.1.zip and unzip to /opt
2. apt-get install gcc-4.9 g++-4.9
3. ./setup.py and source command
4. ./install-deps-linux.sh
6. cocos new MyGame -p com.erikaemma.mygame -l cpp -d ~/WorkSpace/test/cocos_test
7. cocos run -p linux

The errors:
`
[100%] Linking CXX executable bin/MyGame
lib/libcocos2dInternal.a(CCFontAtlas.cpp.o)：在函数‘cocos2d::FontAtlas::~FontAtlas()’中：
/home/erikaemma/WorkSpace/test/cocos_test/MyGame/cocos2d/cocos/2d/CCFontAtlas.cpp:120：对‘libiconv_close’未定义的引用
lib/libcocos2dInternal.a(CCFontAtlas.cpp.o)：在函数‘cocos2d::FontAtlas::conversionU32TOGB2312(std::basic_string<char32_t, std::char_traits<char32_t>, std::allocator<char32_t> > const&, std::unordered_map<unsigned int, unsigned int, std::hash<unsigned int>, std::equal_to<unsigned int>, std::allocator<std::pair<unsigned int const, unsigned int> > >&)’中：
/home/erikaemma/WorkSpace/test/cocos_test/MyGame/cocos2d/cocos/2d/CCFontAtlas.cpp:214：对‘libiconv_open’未定义的引用
/home/erikaemma/WorkSpace/test/cocos_test/MyGame/cocos2d/cocos/2d/CCFontAtlas.cpp:228：对‘libiconv’未定义的引用
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
CMakeFiles/MyGame.dir/build.make:170: recipe for target 'bin/MyGame' failed
make[2]: *** [bin/MyGame] Error 1
CMakeFiles/Makefile2:74: recipe for target 'CMakeFiles/MyGame.dir/all' failed
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/MyGame.dir/all] Error 2
Makefile:83: recipe for target 'all' failed
make: *** [all] Error 2
执行命令出错，返回值：2。
`
BUT MY ICONV VERSION IS 1.14!

If I try to build cocos2d-x by source code, the error will be:
`/usr/bin/ld: 最后的链结失败: 输出不可表示的节`
and like:
`relocation R_X86_64_32 against symbol `_ZN15CProfileManager4RootE' can not be used when making a shared object; recompile with -fPIC`

My GCC and G++ version have 6, 5.3.0 and 4.9.4. But no one can work.

PS: I have installed OpenBLAS. I didn't know wether is can make those wrong

I put my error on http://forum.cocos.com/t/ubuntu17-04-x64-cocos2d-x/50103 but no one help me.

data.title: TransitionPageTurn source code mistake
Fix alpha blending during the animation of TransitionCrossFade.
data.body: This PR fixes the incorrect blending in TransitionCrossFade that causes the transition to be darker than it should.

data.title: [ci skip]update version and readme
Crash on dispatchEventToListeners caused by vector size overflow
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: Galaxy S6 Edge, SM-G532M, Galaxy Tab3 Lite, LG-M250, HUAWEI Y6 Compact
- developing environments
   - NDK version: r13b
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Throw a custom event
Here is the crashlytics callstack
![screen shot 2017-08-16 at 17 19 09](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31069521/29365180-17f45536-82a7-11e7-90c7-b842d728b6b2.png)

The body of dispatchProgressBarUpdatedEvent:
`
void MeterProgressBar::dispatchProgressBarUpdatedEvent()
{
    m_eventDispatcher->dispatchCustomEvent(METER_PROGRESS_BAR_UPDATED_EVENT);
}
`

It is called in a scheduled method which is unscheduled in the dtor.

The crash happens randomly only at 5% of the calls to dispatchProgressBarUpdatedEvent

data.title: add new CMakeLists.txt to cpp-template-default
data.body:
New `CmakeLists.txt` for `cpp-template-default` based on `cpp-empty-test/CMakeLists.txt`. 

It can:
build and run binary on `linux+gcc`
build and run valid .app (bundle) on `macOS+clang`
build and run valid .exe on `VisualStudio+nmake` (`cmake -G "NMake Makefiles"`)
generate valid `Xcode` project for `macOS` (`cmake -G Xcode`)
generate valid `Visual Studio` project for `win32`  (`cmake -G "Visual Studio 14"`)

Full backward compatibility.  `ANDROID` target not changed.

Full history on https://gist.github.com/MrCapone/ccdc1826cb7362086107e8096bfe6f90

fixes issue https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/16900

data.title: Fix android compile fail bug
data.body:
Newest version of cocos2dx run "cocos compile -p android --android-studio" failed on reason:

```
{PROJECT_NAME}/frameworks/runtime-src/proj.android-studio/app/src/org/cocos2dx/javascript/AppActivity.java:31: error: cannot find symbol
    protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
                            ^
  symbol:   class Bundle
  location: class AppActivity
```
because of the method ```protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)``` was override but Bundle class not imported.

Add "import android.os.Bundle" would be ok.

data.title: fixed #17989: touch stops responding on android devices.
data.body:
It's caused by `FileUtils::getContents` is invoked in different threads and we use EventDispatcher::dispatchCustomEvent in `FileUtilsAndroid::getContents` to send an event to EngineDataManager.
Since EngineDataManager class is only for internal use and EventDispatcher isn't thread-safe, we make `EngineDataManager::onBeforeReadFile` public and invoke it `FileUtilsAndroid::getContents`.

data.title: Vec2 (2D) MoveTo forces Z coordinate to 0
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.13.1 (but same on latest)
- devices test on: Windows

In my opinion this is more of bad design than a bug. When you call MoveTo::create(Vec2()) it does not preserve z coordinate. It took me a long time to figure out why my 2D animations weren't ordering correctly when placed in a 3D environment.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a BillBoard
2. Add a few 2D Sprites to a billboard, setup z coordinates for all of them
3. setPositionZ() for all sprites on the billboard
4. Call MoveTo::create(Vec2(x,y)) on a few sprites -> all moves to Z coordinate 0 (CCActionInterval.cpp around line 1253)

So you ask why not just use MoveTo::create(Vec3)? It becomes really inconvenience as every Vec2 would need to become Vec3(x,y, sprite->getPositionZ()) if you are just trying to move a sprite on the same x-y plane, otherwise the Z coordinate always goes to 0. This messes up the sprite draw orders as sprites in 3D environment is affected by z coordinate and not z-order. This makes MoveTo(Vec2()) pretty useless in 3D unless you don't manage z coordinate at all. So my suggestion is either do not allow MoveTo(Vec2()) on 3D parents or simply just preserve z coordinate when doing 2D MoveTo. I recommend the latter as it would not affect movements in 2D environment, yet still useful for 3D environments.

data.title: Can't push same scene again
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: git
- devices test on: linux mint 18.2
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version:
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Steps to Reproduce:

`src/views/SceneTwo.lua`:

    local SceneTwo = cc.Scene:create()
    
    function SceneTwo:onCreate()
    	print('SceneTwo onCreate')
    	local BackButton = cc.MenuItemImage:create('prev.png', 'prev.png')
    	BackButton:registerScriptTapHandler(function()
    		cc.Director:getInstance():popScene()
    	end)
    	BackButton:setPosition(cc.p(0, display.height))
    	BackButton:setAnchorPoint(cc.p(0, 1))
    
    	local BackMenu = cc.Menu:create()
    	BackMenu:setPosition(cc.p(0, 0))
    	BackMenu:addChild(BackButton)
    	self:addChild(BackMenu)
    	local button = require 'button'(self)
    end
    
    SceneTwo:onCreate()
    
    return SceneTwo
Code to go to `SceneTwo`:

	local scene = require 'views.SceneTwo'
	-- package.loaded['views.SceneTwo'] = nil
	print(scene)
	cc.Director:getInstance():pushScene(scene)
It works okay if uncomment second line, but in other case it crashes with segfault.

I started making some modification on classes, added new ones.

data.title: V3 android cmake support
data.body:
CMake build improvements & android CMake support 
add to graddle.properties
PROP_NDK_MODE=cmake 
replace files in folder external/android-specific 
[android-specific.zip](https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/files/1217221/android-specific.zip)

last PR https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/17100

pull request for external
https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x-3rd-party-libs-bin/pull/300
